data.title: Greay choice for Vegetarian Sushi Rolls
data.text: This was the first time we went to this place. I have always passed this and today wanted to give it a shot. Being Vegetarian's we didn't know what to order so had the puzzled look on our face. Stella one of the waitress there helped us with what we can eat and cannot and made some great suggestions. By the time food arrived and we finished it our opinion changed to having one of the best Vegetarian Sushi we have had in a while.

data.title: Sushi
data.text: Always fresh, creative, and fun. Mary is the best, makes us feel at home. Great bargain for the price, we like to go once or twice a month.

data.title: The freshest sushi on the North Side of Chicago at a bargain price!
data.text:
My Mom and I stopped for lunch in-between doctors’ visits, and we only had one hour.
We arrived at 11:20am but were admitted graciously even though the restaurant opens at 11:30am for lunch.  We got menus and water promptly but advised we could not put orders through until 11:30am.  Fair enough!

I ordered the luncheon special, sushi, Chef’s choice of fish. My selection was two kinds of tuna, salmon, red snapper and one mystery fish which was delicious.  My Mom ordered the bento box with beef teriyaki, vegetable tempura, California rolls and rice.  Both of us were more than pleased with our lunches.  In my opinion, this is the best sushi for the dollar on the North Side of Chicago.

data.title: great restaurant
data.text: great food and service ,,comfortable atmosphere  feels like home,, great staff ,, very pleased over all 10 out of ten

data.title: Amazing sushi
data.text: Some of the best sushi I've ever had. So fresh and tasty. The rolls are a good size and they have a huge variety of them. The restaurant is clean and cute. Husband and I love coming here. The staff is so incredibly friendly. Absolutely love this place!

data.title: Excellent quality!
data.text: Great quality, flavor and presentation of sashimi, sushi, and maki.  Excellent value as well.  I have dines in multiple times and have also ordered carryout- I have not been disappointed!

data.title: Stopped thanks to reviews on TA, excellent food and service.
data.text: The sushi was fantastic. Fresh, well made rolls. The restaurant is also very clean and the staff very friendly. Highly recommended.

data.title: Great meal every time
data.text:
Large rolls with fresh fish, very good value
Presentations are usually very unique which adds to the experience 
Restaurant is clean
Soups also were delicious
Staff very friendly
Wife and I love coming here

data.title: Best sushi ever!
data.text:
I love this place! I have never had a bad meal, and the staff is so nice and helpful.  The sushi is delicious, and you can't beat happy hour or their lunch specials.  My husband and I tried to go at least once a week, and all of our girls nights end up here.  Their desserts are great, and their Saki is hot.  

Perfect evening out with the hubby or gf's.  It is in the heart of Des Plaines across from the metra, you can't miss it, and sure don't want to.

data.title: Nice Atmosphere. Intimate. Quiet.
data.text: For the reasons listed above and the good plates presented to us, we like this a lot better than Maki in Park Ridge. Communication is sometimes a little but difficult when we place an order for takeout rather than dining in but this is a restaurant worth patronizing.

data.title: I'm not a sushi person
data.text: Therefore, I cannot rate the sushi, because I didn't eat it.  We love their Katsu and their Teriyaki.  Dessert is so yummy!

data.title: Hands down...the BEST sushi anywhere!
data.text: We have had our vast share of authentic Japanese cuisine, including multiple spots in downtown Chicago, the west coast, as well as in Hawaii...Dotombori remains our absolute favorite place for amazing, creative, authentic Japanese food. The sushi and sashimi are so fresh and clean...the soups, noodles and dinner boxes all incredible. We cannot stay away and eat there at least once every two weeks, sometimes more. In our household of four, including our kids, it is the chosen spot to celebrate birthdays, special occasions, or just a regular dinner out...The staff is incredibly accommodating, friendly and welcoming, always remembering our favorites and anticipating our needs and wants. The food is prepared and presented in fun and creative ways and is as beautiful to look at as it is to eat. The prices are more than fair for the quality and experience. This is a simple establishment with about twelve tables. It is not fancy, but beyond special. Try the Hawaiian roll (the world's most perfect dish and my personal favorite) and the white tuna tataki...also, the miso soup is amazing, as is the belly plate. We are about to celebrate my husband's 50th there and we look forward to ordering their special "boat"...the chef's best daily selections. Also...they offer "happy hour" with a half price menu on a nice selection before 6pm on weekdays...if you love sushi and Japanese fair, do not miss this place!!

data.title: So glad we found it!
data.text:
Dotombori has been on our list of Japanese restaurants to try for a long time. Wish we'd tried it first. The nigiri sushi was perfect. We've seldom had as good and only one place (now gone, alas) was even slightly better. The pieces are the perfect size, too. They also have an extensive menu of sushi rolls. I'm not a huge fan of rolls, but these are so delicious-looking I'm definitely going to have some next visit. They are also enormous, compared to most other places, and it's not because they use a lot of rice—just the right amount, as in the nigiri sushi. 

The kani-su salad contained enough crab to make a light lunch, and the cucumber was cut into long, slightly curled strips. The dressing perfectly complimented both the crab and the cucumber. The miso soup is very good.

I had the tempura udon, and it was excellent. The tempura was equal to the best I've had. My wife had the beef teriyaki, which was prepared almost as a stir-fry. She loved it, and I can't wait to sample the leftovers tonight. Portions are generous.

I generally don't care for tea with toasted rice in it. I liked it here! I've probably never had it done properly before.

Their house sake deserves mention. We decided to try it for starters, and never ordered anything else. Slightly sweet, and delightful at all temperatures from hot to room temperature.

Service was very polite and attentive. These folks want to make you happy. Decor is pleasant but not fancy, distinctly Japanese but not traditional. Pleasant ambiance, although the music is not traditional Japanese—a plus if you don't care for that sort of thing—and not intrusive.

The only real negative I can think of is a lack of parking during the week (weekends are no problem, as the Metra parking lots across the street are wide open and free at that time.) They also don't have sukiyaki on the menu—but you can get good sukiyaki almost anywhere.

Dotombori has taken over first place in our short list of Japanese restaurants—and that is not easy to do.

data.title: Our favorite place for Sushi.
data.text: If you are looking for a quality place with a pleasant atmosphere and great food this is your place. Located in downtown Des Plaines it's a cozy restaurant that meets our standards. Everyone that we've eaten there is well prepared and delicious.

data.title: Excellent, authentic, Japanese food, nicely priced.
data.text: Hidden gem in Des Plaines. This city is mostly known for Taquerias, but Dotombori is over the top excellent!

data.title: No good
data.text:
Work nearby so came here for lunch with a colleague. She wanted Kurumaya which is an authentic Japanese-owned restaurant, but it's a bit of a trek. Dotomobori is an OK substitute... since I am pregnant and cannot eat raw sushi, I didn't feel like I was missing too much by not going to Kurumaya. This restaurant is Korean-owned so we ordered the bulgogi bento box. My friend was VERY HUNGRY and it took a long time for our food to come out. The first time they gave us a teriyaki Chicken bento box. It was obviously a mistake since 2 other bentos went to a different table at the same time, but the people there started eating right away and the servers could not salvage our food. They did not apologize or give any explanation and made us wait another 10 minutes for our food. Bulgogi was seasoned ok, not too saucy, but the beef was really chewy and in big wads. Tempura was over battered and fried. Pieces were very big and difficult to eat gracefully. Came with 4 California roll pieces. We did not get any salad or miso soup with our bento lunches, not sure if they were supposed to come with. Overall, food was neither bad nor good. The cheap prices make up for it though, $7.95 for the lunch bento.

Updated from 3 to 2 stars: My coworker said I was too generous with my original 3 stars. It's been a couple hours since we ate here and she now feels sick from the oily food and can still taste the oil.

data.title: Generous portions and quality presentation
data.text: My cousin and I like to get out once a month to try Sushi restaurants in each other's area.  We went to Dotombori in early February and had a terrific lunch.  I was pleasantly surprised at how much food we received for a lunch visit and the quality of the food as well.  We ordered two specialty rolls that were huge.  They were carefully prepared and offered two completely different flavors.  I ordered a Bento Box too as sometimes I just want a beef/chicken dish.  This was full of taste as well and was of much better quality than other bento's I've had before.  My cousin also commented that he thought they had the best Miso soup he'd eaten.   They are very creative and attentive and I think this is a terrific stop for anyone who enjoys sushi.

data.title: Yummy Sushi!
data.text: Went out for a quick lunch for a sushi fix.  Excellent food, prices and service!  I'll be back😄 The presentation was beautiful!  I also really enjoyed their green tea, they serve the tea with toasted brown rice, Highly recommend!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

data.title: Eventually you are part of their family!
data.text: Best sushi in town, hands down. They remember my name and order most of the time when I call. Take out holds up well. Fresh ingredients, unusual combos and great quality. It's the only sushi I eat on a regular basis. Highly recommend for sushi, and that is so good that we've never tried anything else.

data.title: They Treat You Like Family
data.text: This place was so awesome.  The food was to die for it was so delicious.  It was like we we're family there. They went out of there way to make us feel welcome.  The saki there was great.  I had several dishes that we're delicious and then at the end of the meal they brought us a free desert because they knew we we're getting married the next day.  I recommend this place to anyone who loves authentic Japanese food.
